channel.title: 3rd Age Sword concept
channel.description:
I drew this up in like 10mins :D you can model it if you want someone ;P
mod if you feel this is the wrong section you can move it if you want :D lol
[img]http://i38.tinypic.com/sw4yes.jpg[/img]
idc what you do with the model when you've made it, release to me whatever :D lol

item.title: 3rd Age Sword concept
item.dc:creator: @h1_sk1ller h1 sk1ller
item.description:
@h1_sk1ller wrote:

[quote=“the wanderer, post:10, topic:358141”][quote author=h1 sk1ller link=topic=454648.msg3330976#msg3330976 date=1283469040]

Concept Art usually is consisted of a model on a 30° angle and then a frontal and a side view. Sometimes a back view is needed, and close ups of detailed parts.

Im sure “some very few people” like you do it that way, but most people can work it out from just those views…

and reyx7 the handles supposed to be like that XD
[/quote]

If you have ever looked at concept art there is a way you draw it. It’s not “here’s a picture of a sword I drew model it please.” The concept artists have to detail it so that when the modelers look at it they don’t have any questions on about how the model works/looks. I know this was probably just a drawing, but I’m telling you the rules Same thing with engineers.[/quote]

Im sure anyone who’s not retarded can see what it will look like XD I didn’t add captions or labels or notes to it or anything but it took 10minutes…

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Age Sword concept
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“h1 sk1ller, post:8, topic:358141”][quote author=the wanderer link=topic=454648.msg3330037#msg3330037 date=1283394656]
Concept Art usually is consisted of a model on a 30° angle and then a frontal and a side view. Sometimes a back view is needed, and close ups of detailed parts.
[/quote]

Im sure “some very few people” like you do it that way, but most people can work it out from just those views…

and reyx7 the handles supposed to be like that XD[/quote]

If you have ever looked at concept art there is a way you draw it. It’s not “here’s a picture of a sword I drew model it please.” The concept artists have to detail it so that when the modelers look at it they don’t have any questions on about how the model works/looks. I know this was probably just a drawing, but I’m telling you the rules Same thing with engineers.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Age Sword concept
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Well, first thing I saw was the blocky handle. It’s not curved enough. Use lines that are rounded to arch part of the handle, which will give the illusion of being 3d and round.

Read full topic

item.title: 3rd Age Sword concept
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“h1 sk1ller, post:4, topic:358141”][quote author=dylan_0789 link=topic=454648.msg3329514#msg3329514 date=1283373671]
Its not a bad base design, slightly disproportioned but its hard to sketch something proportionally perfect.

Also, I know this was off topic, but I thought you said you were never posting here again?
[/quote]

Said I wasn’t modeling for RSPS again…

Your design looks like you’re going to trace it.

I don’t trace, its called a concept not a design, also what other views would I draw with it then?[/quote]
Side?

Read full topic
